News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Reports Q3FY26 Results
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills posted Q3FY26 revenue of ₹172.58 lakhs vs ₹67.03 lakhs in Q3FY25. Net loss from continuing operations was ₹201.70 lakhs compared to ₹142.75 lakhs in the previous year.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Board Approves Share Capital Reduction
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills' board approved a scheme to reduce share capital, adjusting ₹278.39 crores accumulated losses against equity and preference shares to rationalize capital structure.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Reports Quarterly Loss of ₹178.28 Lakhs
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills Limited reported a net loss of ₹178.28 lakhs for the quarter ended September 30, 2025, compared to a loss of ₹310.96 lakhs in the same quarter last year. The company's income from operations declined to ₹103.08 lakhs from ₹150 lakhs in the corresponding quarter of the previous year, with losses reported in both continuing and discontinued operations.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Reports Cybersecurity Incident, Operations Unaffected
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills experienced a cybersecurity incident that impacted some IT assets, which have been isolated by the company's technical team. The incident did not affect the company's operations, and management is examining the matter while taking appropriate actions to address the security breach.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Reports Quarterly Results Amid Going Concern Uncertainty
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills Limited announced unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025, with the board meeting held on November 14, 2025. The company faces significant financial distress with negative net worth of Rs. 17,247.41 lakhs and discontinued manufacturing operations at Ambivali, raising material uncertainty about its ability to continue as a going concern.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Reports Quarterly Results with Negative Net Worth of Rs 17,069 Lakhs
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills Limited announced its unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company reported revenue from operations of Rs 111.59 lakhs, down from Rs 232.36 lakhs in the previous year. The company recorded a net loss of Rs 139.30 lakhs from continuing operations. The company's net worth stands at negative Rs 17,069.16 lakhs as of June 30, 2025. The Board also approved adoption of a new Memorandum of Association, subject to shareholder approval at the upcoming Annual General Meeting. The company discontinued its manufacturing operations of paper and paperboard at Ambivali in November 2024 and now focuses on trading activities. The auditors issued a qualified review report citing material uncertainty about the company's ability to continue as a going concern due to the negative net worth and discontinued manufacturing operations.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Announces Fund Raising Plans
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills has revealed plans to raise funds in the upcoming fiscal years. The company intends to raise 100 million rupees during the financial year 2024-25 and 250 million rupees in the financial year 2025-26.

News.Title: Balkrishna Paper Mills Announces Fund Raising Plans for FY 2024-26
News.Summary: Balkrishna Paper Mills has announced plans to raise funds in two phases. The company aims to raise 100 million rupees during the fiscal year 2024-25, followed by 250 million rupees in fiscal year 2025-26. This strategic financial move indicates the company's intent to secure capital for future operations or expansion.
